text.0:
Thank you @Facebook, @messenger and @WhatsApp for supporting the upcoming #WorldMentalHealthDay and helping us to raise awareness about #mentalhealth, especially during this #COVID19 crisis. 

https://t.co/fwD8Xz03Ef
text.1:
Feeling stressed?
New WHO guide that provides techniques to help you cope with stress is now available on @WhatsApp 

Check it here 
:backhand_index_pointing_right: https://t.co/T7m2M9QOPN

https://t.co/bXCYpeQIgw
text.2:
These are the key priorities for the next 3 months of the #COVID19 response:
-We must realize the full potential of the ACT-Accelerator
-We must all continue to make the most of the tools we have
-We must #ACTogether in solidarity!
#EBSpecial 

https://t.co/ihEdSjADiR
text.3: The #COVID19 pandemic is a wake-up call for all of us. We must all look in the mirror & ask what can we do better? Many Member States have come forward with suggestions about how to strengthen the global system for emergency preparedness & response. We thank them all! #EBSpecial
text.4:
I reminded the #EBSpecial Member States that @WHO has the unique mandate & capacity to coordinate the global #COVID19 response, by harnessing the collective strength of our many partners. And this has only been possible because of them, our Member States.

This is their WHO.
text.5: Delighted to address @WHO #EBSpecial on #COVID19. Numbers of cases & deaths can blind us to the reality that every single life lost is someone who loved & was loved by others – someone’s mother, father, sister, brother, daughter or son. They are the reason we’re convening today. https://t.co/kI8ixmFKQJ https://t.co/FyY7uVVdi3
text.6:
WHO has issued guidance to countries on how to maintain essential services - including for #mentalhealth - during #COVID19 and recommends that countries allocate resources to mental health as an integral component of their response and recovery plans. 

:backhand_index_pointing_right: https://t.co/xHpFEYEcWI https://t.co/ReWAO1RkGn
text.7:
Countries reported widespread disruptions to #mentalhealth services due to #COVID19:
:small_orange_diamond: >60% for vulnerable people
:small_orange_diamond: 67% to counseling & psychotherapy
:small_orange_diamond: 35% to emergency interventions
:small_orange_diamond: 30% to access for medications
:small_orange_diamond: 3/4 to :school: & workplace services

https://t.co/8TnBJHU5uf
text.8: The full remarks by @DrTedros at the #EBSpecial on #COVID19 :backhand_index_pointing_down: https://t.co/O0RtdBxThs
text.9: "Everyone must play their part, from the individual decisions we make to protect ourselves & others, to the discussions we will have this week on behalf of the people we serve. We’re all in this together. Let’s use all the energy we have to fight #COVID19"-@DrTedros #EBSpecial https://t.co/oRlddZ4Vk1
text.10: ":keycap_digit_three: I will never tire of calling for solidarity. Finger-pointing will not prevent a single infection. Apportioning blame will not save a single life. What saves lives is national unity and global solidarity"-@DrTedros #EBSpecial #COVID19 #ACTogether https://t.co/PbkvsiuUmA
text.11:
":keycap_digit_two:we must all continue to make the most of the tools we have:
#handhygiene
physical distancing
respiratory etiquette
#WearAMask
ventilation
surveillance
isolation
compassionate care
contact tracing & quarantine
We know all this works and that’s why WHO says: do it all"-@DrTedros https://t.co/ZWuphtL8qj
text.12:
"With the northern hemisphere #influenza season approaching & #COVID19 cases increasing in many countries, there are :keycap_digit_three: key priorities for the next :keycap_digit_three: months.

:keycap_digit_one: we must realize the full potential of the ACT Accelerator"-@DrTedros #EBSpecial #ACTogether

https://t.co/mVrEjAzHav
text.13:
"#COVID19 has demonstrated that highly infectious pathogens cannot be contained by any single sovereign state.
We can only confront them by working together in solidarity, & with a One Health approach, addressing the links between human, animal & planetary health"-@DrTedros https://t.co/zGrGfoGxmt
text.14:
"For us, change is a constant.

We can never sit still.

Science and disease patterns are constantly evolving – and so must WHO"-@DrTedros #EBSpecial #COVID19 https://t.co/lavkWRlKII
text.15:
"The #COVOD19 pandemic is a wake-up call for all of us. We must all look in the mirror & ask what can we do better?
We are totally committed to accountability. And we are committed to continuous learning, continuous listening & continuous improvement"-@DrTedros #EBSpecial https://t.co/rTBdwRkHR3
text.16: Digital technologies are revolutionizing healthcare. Pleased to sign a Memorandum of Understanding with :Estonia: Prime Minister @ratasjuri on a framework for #digitalhealth & innovation. I thank the :Estonia: Government for all of the support & for collaborating with @WHO. #HealthForAll https://t.co/tahEXoh6IS
text.17:
The Access to #COVID19 Tools (ACT) Accelerator is a ground-breaking global collaboration to accelerate the development, production, and equitable access to diagnostics, therapeutics and vaccines.
More: https://t.co/M6CpjKRrpH
 
#ACTogether
 
#EBSpecial 

https://t.co/mVrEjAzHav
text.18:
#COVID19 is :up-right_arrow_selector: demand for mental health services.

Bereavement, isolation, loss of income & fear are triggering #mentalhealth conditions or exacerbating existing ones. Many people may be facing increased levels of alcohol & drug use, insomnia, & anxiety

:backhand_index_pointing_right:https://t.co/m6fLGxM1O7 https://t.co/jPdjpyb4cC
text.20:
WHO works across the world with >7000 staff, 150 country offices, 6 regional offices directing, coordinating & strengthening health systems, health through the life-course; non- & communicable diseases; preparedness, surveillance & response.

#EBSpecial

https://t.co/n739VYQMuI
text.21:
The :NEW_button: survey of 130 countries provides the first global :globe_with_meridians: data showing the devastating impact of #COVID19 on access to #mentalhealth services and underscores the urgent need for increased funding.

:backhand_index_pointing_right: https://t.co/m6fLGxM1O7 https://t.co/cz1IjX0fB3
text.22:
#COVID19 has disrupted or halted critical #mentalhealth services in 93% of countries worldwide :globe_with_meridians: while the demand for mental health is increasing, according to :NEW_button: survey

:backhand_index_pointing_right: https://t.co/m6fLGxM1O7 https://t.co/C0AISMbS3O
text.23:
"The #COVID19 pandemic is a powerful demonstration of why the “triple billion” targets we are so important & why we must pursue them with even more determination.

We’re on the right path, but we need to:

-go faster

-go further

-go together"-@DrTedros #EBSpecial https://t.co/flEOM9yhr9
text.24: "Just as many countries invest heavily in their military capacity in case of conflict, so they must invest in robust public health capacities to prepare for, prevent, detect and respond rapidly to outbreaks when they occur"-@DrTedros #EBSpecial #COVID19
text.25: "When people do need health services, those services must be accessible, affordable and high-quality"-@DrTedros #EBSpecial #COVID19 #HealthForAll
text.26: "Our first priority must be to keep people healthy & out of :hospital:, by addressing the root causes of disease in the air people breathe, the food they eat, the water they drink & the environment in which they live & work"-@DrTedros #EBSpecial
text.27: "Health and well-being, universal health coverage and emergency preparedness and response are three strands of a rope that together provide strong support for social, economic and political stability"-@DrTedros #EBSpecial #COVID19  https://t.co/oWH310aY3h
text.28:
"Our transformation started with the 13th General of Programme of Work, which you endorsed two years ago, with a new mission statement and the ambitious “triple billion” targets"-@DrTedros #EBSpecial #COVID19 

https://t.co/8X3T0gWcfL
text.29: "New Division of Emergency Preparedness has developed the #COVID19 Partners Platform, supported intra-action reviews & is working closely with the Universal Health Coverage divisions to improve & maintain public health functions & essential health services"-@DrTedros #EBSpecial https://t.co/jMMBileUBG
text.30: "Working with the Emergencies programme & building on the R&D Blueprint, our newly-formed Science Division has brought researchers from around the :globe_showing_Europe-Africa: to identify priorities, initiated Solidarity Trial & quality-assured our scientific publications & guidance"-@DrTedros #EBSpecial https://t.co/lDhstE9U8u
text.31: "Everything we have accomplished together in the past 9 months has only been possible because of the deep-rooted transformation that we have designed & implemented together over the past 3 years"-@DrTedros #EBSpecial #COVID19 https://t.co/qUP6na8Ihz
text.32:
"The guidance we provide is not just written by WHO staff, it’s developed in close consultation with experts from your national institutions, drawing on professional networks developed over decades"-@DrTedros #EBSpecial #COVID19 

https://t.co/rutdlkZPSX
text.33:
"And it has only been possible because of you, our Member States.

This is your WHO"-@DrTedros #EBSpecial #COVID19 

https://t.co/zDaWlxx2Zy
text.34: "WHO doesn’t have the mandate or the capacity to do everything. But we do have the unique mandate & capacity to coordinate the :globe_showing_Europe-Africa: #COVID19 response, by harnessing the collective strength of our many partners across the @UN system & beyond"-@DrTedros #EBSpecial https://t.co/5y7HguMddq
text.35:
"COVAX is supporting the development of 9 #COVID19 vaccines, with more in the pipeline.
168 countries & economies are covered by the facility, representing over 2/3 of the :globe_showing_Europe-Africa:’s population & we are still in discussion with another 25 countries"-@DrTedros #EBSpecial #ACTogether https://t.co/fzWRyGBBEk
text.36: "As soon as data were published showing #dexamethasone was effective in treating patients with severe #COVID19, we secured critical supplies for up to 4.5M patients, to ensure patients in lower-income countries don’t miss out on this life-saving medicine"-@DrTedros #EBSpecial https://t.co/SEvVn2pOEk
text.37:
"Together with our partners, last week we reached an agreement to make 120 million new rapid #COVID19 tests available to low- and middle-income countries"-@DrTedros #EBSpecial #ACTogether 

https://t.co/PD5FK1O4a9
text.38:
"In April, the Access to #COVID19 Tools Accelerator was born – an unprecedented global partnership that is delivering tangible results, based on two objectives:

-accelerating development of products

-fair distribution"-@DrTedros #EBSpecial 

#ACTogether https://t.co/mVrEjAzHav
text.39: "More than 12,000 patients have now been enrolled in the WHO #COVID19 Solidarity Therapeutics Trial, in nearly 500 hospitals in 29 countries"-@DrTedros #EBSpecial https://t.co/QR7PKWVDnA
text.40:
"We have sourced, validated, purchased & delivered masks, gloves, respirators, gowns, goggles, swabs, tests, reagents, thermometers, oxygen concentrators, ventilators and more, to 177 countries & territories around the world"-@DrTedros #EBSpecial #COVID19 
https://t.co/5T3Uevskdf
text.41: "WHO and our partners sent expert missions to more than 130 countries to provide operational and technical support"-@DrTedros #EBSpecial #COVID19 https://t.co/XBoZXzi3aO
text.42: "Our country teams have worked closely with governments to write national plans and identify needs, and to match those needs with more than 600 partners and 74 donors through the groundbreaking #COVID19 Partners Platform"-@DrTedros #EBSpecial https://t.co/QmyEdYMXjV
text.43: "Through the https://t.co/RjHSBkVjlH online learning platform, we have built country capacity by providing free training in 133 #COVID19 courses, from infection prevention & control to clinical management, operational planning, data collection & much more"-@DrTedros #EBSpecial
text.44:
"10 months ago, #COVID19 was completely unknown to the :globe_showing_Europe-Africa:. We've now published more than 400 guidance documents for individuals, communities, schools, businesses, industries, health workers, health facilities & governments"-@DrTedros #EBSpecial #COVID19 

https://t.co/8bpSWomK87
text.45:
"WHO didn’t isolate the virus, we didn’t sequence or publish the genome, we didn’t manufacture the assays and we don’t make PCR machines.

But it was WHO that connected the dots to give countries the capacity to find and respond to this new virus"-@DrTedros #EBSpecial #COVID19 https://t.co/GC6JJUAMx8
text.46:
"Since then we have distributed millions of #COVID19 tests to more than 150 countries.

No laboratory test in history has been developed and deployed as rapidly"-@DrTedros #EBSpecial https://t.co/efBnjsFdWE
text.47:
"On the 2nd of February the first #COVID19 tests were produced & we began shipping them around the :globe_showing_Europe-Africa:.

At the same time, we worked to expand PCR testing capacity around the :globe_showing_Europe-Africa:, leveraging national influenza centres & building capacity where it was lacking"-@DrTedros #EBSpecial https://t.co/yui1Z5NA3s
text.48:
"But even before that, one of our highest priorities was to rapidly identify the new virus & enable countries to test for it.
Within 2 weeks of the 1st cases being reported to WHO, we developed & published the 1st protocol for developing a PCR test"-@DrTedros #EBSpecial #COVID19 https://t.co/Uhg3KtXv05
text.49:
"On the 30th of January, I declared a public health emergency of international concern – the highest level of alarm under international law.

Just 4 days later, WHO published our first strategic preparedness and response plan"-@DrTedros #EBSpecial #COVID19
https://t.co/JvKC0PTett
text.50: "Since the beginning of the #COVID19 pandemic, WHO has worked around the clock to support countries to prepare and respond to this new virus"-@DrTedros #EBSpecial https://t.co/VHnOKYYTdA
text.51:
"What we’ve learned in every region of the :globe_showing_Europe-Africa: is that with:

-Strong leadership

-Clear & comprehensive strategies

-Consistent communication

-Engaged, empowered & enabled population

it’s never too late. Every #COVID19 situation can be turned around"-@DrTedros #EBSpecial https://t.co/Fywrcz9RW1
text.52:
"Although all countries have been affected by #COVID19, we must remember that this is an uneven pandemic.

10 countries account for 70% of all reported cases and deaths, and just 3 countries account for half"-@DrTedros #EBSpecial https://t.co/BHmy1NvMHS
text.53:
"Numbers can blind us to the reality that every single life lost is someone who loved & was loved by others – someone’s mother, father, someone’s sister, someone’s brother, daughter or son.

They are the reason we’re here"-@DrTedros #EBSpecial 

https://t.co/nJT9DqCulA https://t.co/Ny2IZ1Y9W7
text.54:
"It seems incredible to think that when the #EB146 met in Feb, there were just 151 cases & 1 death outside :China: of what we now call #COVID19.

Today, almost 35M cases of COVID-19 have now been reported to WHO, & 1M+ people are reported to have lost their lives"-@DrTedros #EBSpecial https://t.co/QbTdKwTVds
text.55: Live: @DrTedros' opening remarks at the #EBSpecial on #COVID19 https://t.co/uGm36fb9Yk
text.56: Live: Opening of the #EBSpecial with chairperson @drharshvardhan https://t.co/pAndHFIZvc
text.57: At the #EBSpecial, @DrTedros will submit an interim report of a brief summary of WHO’s activities since Jan 2020 in response to the #COVID19 pandemic & will set out the steps taken to ensure that appropriate lessons are learned & best practices implemented as the pandemic evolves
text.58:
In #EBSpecial Member States will discuss and seek guidance on developments around efforts to implement the strategic preparedness & response plan, as well as the actions taken to initiate the review by an independent panel.

#COVID19

https://t.co/0TLgpsYREy
text.59: Director-General @DrTedros following consultation with the Board Chair, has called for an #EBSpecial session on #COVID19 response to follow up on the World Health Assembly resolution approved by Member States earlier in May https://t.co/0TLgpsYREy
text.60:
The WHO Executive Board is composed of 34 technically qualified members elected for 3-year terms. 
The main functions of the Board are to implement the decisions & policies of the Health Assembly, advise & generally to facilitate its work https://t.co/rcGgnz1Jvb 

#EBSpecial
text.61:
The WHO Executive Board Special Session #EBSpecial on the #COVID19 response will start today at 12h00 CEST. 

Watch LIVE here: https://t.co/0TLgpsYREy
https://t.co/n739VYQMuI
